greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write n = p+q with p, 6q-1 and 6q+1 all prime
comment: This implies the twin prime conjecture, and it has been verified for n up to 10^9.

Zhi-Wei Sun also made some similar conjectures, for example, any integer n>5 can be written as p+q with p, 2q-3 and 2q+3 all prime, and each integer n>4 can be written as p+q with p, 3q-2+(n mod 2) and 3q+2-(n mod 2) all prime.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Zhi-Wei Sun, Conjectures involving primes and quadratic forms, arXiv:1211.1588.
example: a(3)=1 since 3=2+1 with 2, 6*1-1 and 6*1+1 all prime.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Dec 21 2012
